description: Places an inbound in-app, web, or video call to a contact, and then initiates the flow. It performs the actions in the flow that are specified (in ContactFlowId) and present in the Amazon Connect instance (specified as InstanceId).

parameters.name: Attributes
parameters.description: A custom key-value pair using an attribute map. The attributes are standard Amazon Connect attributes, and can be accessed in flows just like any other contact attributes. There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, -, and _ characters. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If not provided, the Amazon Web Services SDK populates this field. For more information about idempotency, see Making retries safe with idempotent APIs. The token is valid for 7 days after creation. If a contact is already started, the contact ID is returned. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: ContactFlowId
parameters.description: The identifier of the flow for the call. To see the ContactFlowId in the Amazon Connect admin website, on the navigation menu go to Routing, Flows. Choose the flow. On the flow page, under the name of the flow, choose Show additional flow information. The ContactFlowId is the last part of the ARN, shown here in bold: arn:aws:connect:us-west-2:xxxxxxxxxxxx:instance/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx/contact-flow/846ec553-a005-41c0-8341-xxxxxxxxxxxx.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instance ID in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance.

parameters.name: AllowedCapabilities
parameters.description: Information about the video sharing capabilities of the participants (customer, agent). Customer (dict) --- Information about the customer's video sharing capabilities. Video (string) --- The configuration having the video and screen sharing capabilities for participants over the call. ScreenShare (string) --- The screen sharing capability that is enabled for the participant. SEND indicates the participant can share their screen. Agent (dict) --- Information about the agent's video sharing capabilities. SEND indicates the participant can share their screen.

nested_params.name: Customer
nested_params.description: Information about the customer's video sharing capabilities.

nested_params.name: Video
nested_params.description: The configuration having the video and screen sharing capabilities for participants over the call.

nested_params.name: ScreenShare
nested_params.description: The screen sharing capability that is enabled for the participant. SEND indicates the participant can share their screen.

nested_params.name: Agent
nested_params.description: Information about the agent's video sharing capabilities.

nested_params.name: Video
nested_params.description: The configuration having the video and screen sharing capabilities for participants over the call.

nested_params.name: ScreenShare
nested_params.description: The screen sharing capability that is enabled for the participant. SEND indicates the participant can share their screen.

parameters.name: ParticipantDetails
parameters.description: The customer's details. Display name of the participant.

parameters.name: References
parameters.description: A formatted URL that is shown to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP). Tasks can have the following reference types at the time of creation: URL | NUMBER | STRING | DATE | EMAIL. ATTACHMENT is not a supported reference type during task creation. (string) --- (dict) --- Well-formed data on a contact, used by agents to complete a contact request. You can have up to 4,096 UTF-8 bytes across all references for a contact. Value (string) --- A valid value for the reference. For example, for a URL reference, a formatted URL that is displayed to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP). The type of the reference. DATE must be of type Epoch timestamp. Status (string) --- Status of the attachment reference type. Arn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the reference StatusReason (string) --- Relevant details why the reference was not successfully created.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: A valid value for the reference. For example, for a URL reference, a formatted URL that is displayed to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP).

nested_params.name: Type
nested_params.description: The type of the reference. DATE must be of type Epoch timestamp.

nested_params.name: Status
nested_params.description: Status of the attachment reference type.

nested_params.name: Arn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the reference.

nested_params.name: StatusReason
nested_params.description: Relevant details why the reference was not successfully created.

nested_items.name: ConnectionData
nested_items.description: Information required for the client application (mobile application or website) to connect to the call.

nested_items.name: AttendeeId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Chime SDK attendee ID.

nested_items.name: JoinToken
nested_items.description: The join token used by the Amazon Chime SDK attendee.

nested_items.name: MediaRegion
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region in which you create the meeting.

nested_items.name: MediaPlacement
nested_items.description: The media placement for the meeting.

nested_items.name: EventIngestionUrl
nested_items.description: The event ingestion URL to which you send client meeting events.

nested_items.name: MeetingFeatures
nested_items.description: The configuration settings of the features available to a meeting.

nested_items.name: EchoReduction
nested_items.description: Makes echo reduction available to clients who connect to the meeting.

nested_items.name: MeetingId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Chime SDK meeting ID.

nested_items.name: ContactId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the contact in this instance of Amazon Connect.

nested_items.name: ParticipantId
nested_items.description: The identifier for a contact participant. The ParticipantId for a contact participant is the same throughout the contact lifecycle.

nested_items.name: ParticipantToken
nested_items.description: The token used by the contact participant to call the CreateParticipantConnection API. The participant token is valid for the lifetime of a contact participant.
